final_answer.precision_note: Using 1.50 A and 30.0 min gives a 3 significant figure deposited mass estimate.

method: Time is 30.0 min = 1800 s, so charge passed Q = It = 1.50 x 1800 = 2700 C. Moles of electrons are n(e-) = Q/F = 2700/96500 = 0.02798 mol. From Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 mol electrons deposit 1 mol Cu, so n(Cu)=0.02798/2=0.01399 mol. Convert to mass with Cu molar mass 63.55 g mol-1: m = 0.01399 x 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Seconds were used in Q = It by converting 30.0 min to 1800 s.
Electron-to-copper stoichiometry from the half-equation correctly halves electron moles.
